Rock Pang

News
  • Nov 2021: Present Apéritif at UW Colloquium
  • Sep 2021: Submitted my first paper to CHI2022 as the first author
  • May 2021: Attended CHI 2021
  • Dec 2020: Moved to Seattle
  • Oct 2020: Started my PhD program at UW

Hi! I’m a second-year PhD student at Paul G. Allen School of Computer Science & Engineering at the University of Washington. I work with Katharina Reinecke and René Just. I am exploring ways to anticipate and mitigate unintended consequences of emerging computing technologies. Currently I am automatically identifying discussion on societal implication online from newspapers, Twitter, and Reddit. I am also interested in data visualization, cross-culture usability of technology and HCI.

I spent four wonderful years at Macalester College, where I worked with Shilad Sen to visualize Wikipedia articles as maps. Originally intending to study politics, I became more interested how I could use data to convey and visualize ever-changing information contained in the complex and pluralistic global community. In college, I majored in computer science, applied math & statistics and minored in political science.


Publication

  • Yuren Pang, Katharina Reinecke, René Just, “Apéritif: Scaffolding Preregistrations to Automatically Generate Analysis Code and Method Descriptions”, Human Factors in Computing Systems (CHI), 2022 (Revise & Resubmit)
